messages: 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (10:51): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: mutually exclusive subtitles: this is the way virtually all software and hardware media players work. it seems useful to be able to mark up that certain tracks are mutually exclusive (<tracktrack>) so that the UI can create a sane menu.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:52): having multiple subtitle tracks present at one time seems to be on the wrong side of 80/20
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (10:52): the other options are to make all tracks mutually exlcusive or all tracks "parallel", both of which are broken
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:52): if you want to make English subtitles plus Japanese subtitles for language learners for anime, you can package them into one track

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:53): FWIW, in movie theaters in Finland, there are subtitles in Finnish and in Swedish, but they aren't independent tracks
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:53): specifically, the Swedish subtitles aren't bought from Sweden
